      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Expression applySimplifier(Expression expression, Context context)
      We define this method to make this a functional interface again, so that simplifiers can be easily defined with lambda expressions.
      static Expression conditionForSubExpressionsDisequality(Expression expression1, Expression expression2) 
      static boolean isDisequality(Expression expression) 
      static List<Expression> listOfDisequalitiesOfSubExpressions(Expression expression1, Expression expression2) 
      static Expression make(Object expression1Object, Object expression2Object)
      Makes a disequality of two expressions, returning Expressions.FALSE if the expressions are identical.
      static Expression makeWithConstantSimplification(Expression term1, Expression term2, Context context)
      Makes a disequality application on two terms possibly simplifying it (taking constants into account).
      static Expression normalize(Expression expression, Context context)
      Returns X != c, if 'expression' is c != X, for X a variable and c a constant, or 'expression' otherwise.
      static Expression simplify(Expression disequality, Context context)
      Returns FALSE if given disequality has equal arguments, TRUE if they contain distinct constants, and the disequality itself otherwise.
      static Expression simplifyGivenDisequality(Expression disequality, Expression variable, Expression otherTerm)
      Returns an expression equivalent to disequality (and perhaps simpler) given a disequality.
      static Expression simplifyGivenEquality(Expression disequality, Expression variable, Expression otherTerm)
      Returns an expression equivalent to disequality (and perhaps simpler) given equality between a variable and another term.
